unnormalised: I'm a bit confused about identifying myself on different platforms. What exactly are education and employment identifiers, and why are they important?
normalised: I am a bit confused about identifying myself on different platforms. What exactly are education and employment identifiers, and why are they important?

unnormalised: Okay, let's break it down. Education identifiers refer to unique codes or numbers assigned to you during your academic journey. Think of your roll no. in college or your registration number for the JEE exam. Even your CBSE admit card number (e.g., 12345/2024) can serve as an identifier. These help institutions track your progress, exam results, and certifications accurately. It's their way of knowing it's *you*, Riya Sharma from Delhi Public School, who scored 98% and not some other Riya Sharma. They also use things like your Aadhar Number for verification purposes now.
normalised: Okay, let us break it down. Education identifiers refer to unique codes or numbers assigned to you during your academic journey. Think of your roll number in college or your registration number for the J-E-E exam. Even your C-B-S-E admit card number, for example, one two three four five slash two thousand and twenty four, can serve as an identifier. These help institutions track your progress, exam results, and certifications accurately. It is their way of knowing it is you, Riya Sharma from Delhi Public School, who scored ninety eight percent and not some other Riya Sharma. They also use things like your Aadhar Number for verification purposes now.

unnormalised: Employment identifiers, on the other hand, are specific to your professional life. This could be your employee ID (e.g., TCS123456) at Tata Consultancy Services, your EPF number (MH/BOM/1234567/000/000), or even your professional license number if you're a doctor (e.g., Medical Council of India Reg No. 12345) or a lawyer. Many companies will also ask for your PAN number for tax purposes. These identifiers help employers manage payroll, benefits, and track your contributions to the organization. Even freelance platforms might assign you a unique ID number to distinguish you from other freelancers.

Many companies will also ask for your P-A-N number for tax purposes. These identifiers help employers manage payroll, benefits, and track your contributions to the organization. Even freelance platforms might assign you a unique I-D number to distinguish you from other freelancers.

unnormalised: The importance lies in accuracy and security. Imagine someone else claiming your degree or your salary being credited to the wrong account! Identifiers prevent such mix-ups and ensure that your achievements and benefits are correctly attributed to you. Keep these numbers safe and handy.
